Connection.comm: Router is reliable with good coverage.

cont.entity_a: Wireless connection speed is significantly faster compared to Linksys.
cont.entity_b: Router works well with Packet8 VoIP service without reconfiguration.

cont.entity_a: Full signal strength is available throughout the house.
cont.entity_b: The unit provides good range and speed.

cont.entity_a: Setup is straightforward, but the configuration pages are cryptic.
cont.entity_b: Setup is easy and quick, taking about 30 minutes.

cont.entity_a: Advanced firewall configuration is a notable feature.
cont.entity_b: Router is flexible for running 3rd party firmware like Tomato.

cont.entity_a: Installation is easy, but tech support is not knowledgeable about Macs.
cont.entity_b: Router installation is simple with a helpful installation wizard.

cont.entity_a: Customer service is poor with long wait times and unhelpful responses.
cont.entity_b: Setup was straightforward with good customer support.

cont.entity_a: Router requires daily reboots to reset the wireless connection.
cont.entity_b: Router is durable and reliable over several years of use.

cont.entity_a: Router is reliable with good coverage after replacing the Motorola modem.
The router has strong signal strength but can be affected by wireless phones and microwaves.
Router has a good price to feature ratio with strong security options.
Router setup and configuration are easy, but the DHCP server is unreliable.
cont.entity_b: Router has easy-to-use built-in firewalls and tools for wireless access limitation.
Router works well with different operating systems and devices.

cont.entity_a: Firmware and drivers are not optimized for 22 Mbps mode.
cont.entity_b: Firmware is easy to upgrade and adds functionality.
Product arrived on time but without a power adapter.
Router does not work well with PS3 unless directly connected.
